# Course description

This course is designed as a modern introduction to applied data analysis and data visualization using the R programming language.

Participants in the course will have the opportunity to explore confidential microdata using the [Rstudio](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/) development environment and tools from the `tidyverse` suite of R packages within the [ADRF](https://coleridgeinitiative.org/administrative-data-research-facility) secure data environment.

Topics will include data access, manipulation, and summarization as well as coverage of data visualization using the `ggplot2` package.

Upon completion of this short course, participants will have introductory exposure to tools that are applicable to a wide variety of research settings and that will prepare them for more advanced coursework in applied data analytics.

## Basic Course Structure

2 hours per week of instruction

2 hours of homework

4 weeks total course length

::: {.callout collapse="true"}
## Suggested Readings

Wickham, Cetinkaya-Rundel and Grolemund. [R for data science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) 2nd edition
